<Extension()> Public Function FeatureContributionCalculation (catalog As ModelOperationsCatalog.ExplainabilityTransforms, modelParameters As ICalculateFeatureContribution, Optional featureColumn As String = "Features", Optional top As Integer = 10, Optional bottom As Integer = 10, Optional normalize As Boolean = true) As FeatureContributionCalculatingEstimator

static member FeatureContributionCalculation : Microsoft.ML.ModelOperationsCatalog.ExplainabilityTransforms * Microsoft.ML.Internal.Internallearn.ICalculateFeatureContribution * string * int * int * bool -> Microsoft.ML.Data.FeatureContributionCalculatingEstimator

Docs.param: Trained model parameters that support Feature Contribution Calculation and which will be used for scoring.
The name of the feature column that will be used as input.

The number of features with highest positive contributions for each data sample that will be retained in the FeatureContribution column. Note that if there are fewer features with positive contributions than , the rest will be returned as zeros.

The number of features with least negative contributions for each data sample that will be retained in the FeatureContribution column. Note that if there are fewer features with negative contributions than , the rest will be returned as zeros.
Whether the feature contributions should be normalized to the [-1, 1] interval.
Docs.summary: Feature Contribution Calculation computes model-specific contribution scores for each feature. Note that this functionality is not supported by all the models. See for a list of the suported models.
